> 
> Do Pluron and Khato replace Eeloo or do Pluron and Khato go beyond Eeloo?

if you play without OPM Pluron will be a little outside Eeloo's orbit ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I don't make any changes to the stock system with Pluron-Khato
My planet pack is nearing the experimental-release stage. We have a NKO, 3 Main-Belt asteroids, Vesta, and Pluto's moons, Nix and Styx

I would really like to improve Pluron-Khato but I wasted the last couple of days trying to make a decent model for them and it's something I really don't like to do, plus I'm crap at it so the results are really bad.

If anyone with good planet-making skills wants to give it a shot feel free to pm me.

If I get a model that I like I will continue developping the system. Adding biomes, science definitions and everything to make it a good planet pack.

but untill I get a good model (either from someone or by myself) I won't improve the system

sadly I don't have much time, and wasting it on something I'm bad at is not exactly a good decision ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Update:

I managed to get a half decent model for pluron and khato. So ScienceDefs are coming ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
